items.text: full on off stumps, and carefully fended off the front foot
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Rakesh Sampat: "I wonder how these so called "Experts" get paid?? The pitch "Experts" & the commentators who do the "Preview" almost never manage to get the pitch report right and more often than not, the opposite of what they say happens. On a pitch that was supposed to be "Perfect" for batting 1st, BNG already have lost 2 wickets in 10 overs, 1 injured, scored on 24 runs and had 3 simple catches dropped. Asia Cup; Back in the Gulf; wonder; wonder; wonder......" -- you love yourself a conspiracy theory, don't you!
items.text: swept! But can't find the boundary. Lands full on off, but Mushfiqur was already down on one knee for the sweep shot
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: full just outside off, and driven firmly past the bowler's left to long off
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Agha Aamir: "UAE is a place where people belonging to each country in the contest are present with huge numbers. Expect a super charged crowd throughout the tournament. "
items.text: reverse paddle sweep! Pre meditated, and it runs away to the third-man boundary. Full outside off, and he was quick to get into position. Mathews gave it a chase from short third man, but the ball was always going to win that race
items.postText: Rajat Bhardwaj: "T L and S gone. Now only 7 M remaining"
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: good length on middle, and worked off his pads to the leg side. They jog across for one
items.postText: Ananya: "Feel that Bangla has that tinge of confidence against SL..... but not against India...."
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.preText: Twenty-five runs off the last three overs. Thisara to continue.
items.text: short! But wayward, according to umpire Erasmus. Lands on middle, but eventually angles down leg
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 wide

items.text: good length on off, and tapped off the back foot to cover point. Mithun wants the single, but better sense eventually prevails
items.postText: MahneelMusa: "Brother Sreshth, can you kindly ask everyone not to write us off yet because the man with the back to back hundreds, the lower middle order GOAT is yet to come out to bat?" -- Mahmudullah? Mhhm.
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length outside off, and he attempts a square cut. But it's too close to his body, and the shot doesn't have the direction to beat the fielder at point
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of a length on off, and blocked off the back foot
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Kanthikiran: "Why don't Sri Lanka bring in Lasith Malinga and get these 2 batsmen out before they lay a solid platform? " -- Probably because it's too hot to bowl for extended spells. Malinga said he was looking to bowl only 3-4 over spells
items.text: length ball on off stump, and cramping the batsman for space. Blocked, once again, to cover off the back foot
items.postText: Arm_chair_critic: "@sean.. catching in the cold English summer is much worse.. It's like a rock hitting ur hand.. Hot day over a cold day for catching anytime"
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: wide outside off, and he cuts slices a cut past point for one. His top-hand slipped off the bat, and therefore took some pace off that shot
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: slapped past point once again, but this time they collect the second run. Wide outside off, and deserving of the treatment it received. Drinks
items.postText: Time for a break in commentary too. Here's Saurabh Somani to give you company, as I head off to grab a cup of coffee.
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.preText:
Thanks Sreshth. Bangladesh have done well to recover from that horror start.

Here's Dilruwan, over the wicket
items.text: full and Mithun tries to cut but it's too close. goes to  short third man
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: tries the reverse paddle but can't get bat on it and there is a muted lbw appeal. Struck outside the line though
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: takes a big stride out to drive but can't pierce the off-side field
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: That's out of here Skips down the track, and deposits it over long-off. Nice big swing of the bat and the ball is into the stands
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, SIX runs

items.text: rocks back to cut past the fielder at point to find the fence again. The previous ball forced Dilurwan to shorten his length
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: and finds the fence again! Bangladesh have broken free in this over. This one was a touch fuller but driven through the covers
items.shortText: MDK Perera to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.preText: Jay Deshpande: "Already a tense battle out in the middle in the hot sun. In my opinion this Asia Cup will be more exciting than 2016 especially with Afghanistan and Hong Kong participating. May the best team win. Good luck to all!!!"
items.text: strays down the legside and it''s tucked away to square leg for a single
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: keeps it straight and on a length, and Mithun defends it on the offside
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Aruna Caldera: "When they bat well, they ball poorly, when they ball well, they drop catches, When they catch well, their batsmen do poorly, When they do all three well, someone in the opposition done something special - SL Cricket summarised " - that's a bit harsh...
items.text: back of a length on off stumps, he steers it away but point is there to pick it up
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: goes a bit straighter, and allows Mithun to swivel it away to square leg
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: Dananjaya with a brilliant save at point That was back of a length and wider, allowing the batsman to cut it fiercely, but Dananjaya flung himself to his left to get a hand to the ball and stop it
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: steps down the track and probably intended to smash it over cow corner but Thisara shortened his length and the ball's bunted into the legside
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Dhananjaya de Silva into the attack. round the stumps
items.text: poor fielding again by Dilruwan overpitched outside off and allows the batsman to drive, where Dilruwan messes it up on the cover fence. He's not having a good day
items.shortText: de Silva to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs
